Class ParseExportData

  • java.lang.Object
    • ParseExportData

  • public class ParseExportData
extends java.lang.Object
    Doing some simple data analysis on a CSV file of countries, exports, and export value.
    Version:
    1
    Author:
    Jeff Brown

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void bigExporters(org.apache.commons.csv.CSVParser parser, java.lang.String value)
      Prints the country and export value of "big exporters", where "big" means the length of `value` is shorter than the character length of the value in the CSV data represented by `parser`.
      java.lang.String countryInfo(org.apache.commons.csv.CSVParser parser, java.lang.String country)
      Search for `country` in the CSV data represented by `parser`.

      Print the name of all countries that export `exportItem1` and `exportItem2`.
      int numberOfExporters(org.apache.commons.csv.CSVParser parser, java.lang.String exportItem)
      Count how many countries export `exportItem` in the data represented by `parser`.

    • Constructor Detail

      • ParseExportData

        public ParseExportData()

    • Method Detail

      • bigExporters

        public void bigExporters(org.apache.commons.csv.CSVParser parser,
                         java.lang.String value)
        Prints the country and export value of "big exporters", where "big" means the length of `value` is shorter than the character length of the value in the CSV data represented by `parser`.
        Parameters:
        parser - represents the data to search
        value - a string representing the minimum value. Since we don't know how to convert strings to numbers yet, we go off string length.

      • countryInfo

        public java.lang.String countryInfo(org.apache.commons.csv.CSVParser parser,
                                    java.lang.String country)
        Search for `country` in the CSV data represented by `parser`.
        Parameters:
        parser - An instance of `CSVParser` representing the data
        country - The country name to search for.
        Returns:
        If `country` is found, return "country: exports: value (dollars)". If not found, returns "NOT FOUND".

      • listExportersTwoProducts

        public void listExportersTwoProducts(org.apache.commons.csv.CSVParser parser,
                                     java.lang.String exportItem1,
                                     java.lang.String exportItem2)
        Print the name of all countries that export `exportItem1` and `exportItem2`.
        Parameters:
        parser - represents the CSV data
        exportItem1 - the first item to search for
        exportItem2 - the second item to search for

      • numberOfExporters

        public int numberOfExporters(org.apache.commons.csv.CSVParser parser,
                             java.lang.String exportItem)
        Count how many countries export `exportItem` in the data represented by `parser`.
        Parameters:
        parser - represents the data to search
        exportItem - the export item to search for
        Returns:
        the count of countries that export `exportItem`. Returns zero if `exportItem` isn't found or is the empty string.

      • quiz

        public void quiz()
        Used to answer questions posed by the homework practice quiz.

      • tester

        public void tester()
        Test driver for ParseExportData
